page.title: 07HOUSING NEAR GRIMSBY DOCKS
page.content: Areas of 19th Century{terraced,back to {back houses}with{no inside toilets}and no gardens have been demolished near the docks.In their place are{small blocks of{modern,}council built terraced housing providing far superior amenities and also{open {spaces.}This housing is of a much {lower density}than the old.This development has been carried out in recent years in preference to re-housing people on council estates on the outskirts of town.In this way the{strong community spirit}of many streets is preserved.Where old,but larger terraced housing exists,{modernisation}has taken place and these provide pleasant homes most of which are privately owned.Much of the rest of the area is composed of inter-war semi- and detached homes,privately owned and low density.
